page.title: 17Industry
page.content: Irton Waterworks pumps and cleans 4 million gallons to Scarborough each day.It comes from the River Derwent.It is raw water.It is also pumped from 4OO feet down into a well.The cleaning process is simple.Water flows to settlement tanks where solids are settled.Then chlorine is added as a disinfectant and allum which makes dirt cling together.The water flows to tanks,which at the bottom have a layer of sludge.The water flows through,but the sludge stops the dirt getting through.The water flows to rapid gravity filters then it flows to further tanks where it must percolate through a layer of sand.This separates any more dirt.Sulphur Dioxide is added to control the chlorine.The water is pumped to reservoirs.There are 2 main reservoirs in Scarborough.This process is simple yet effective.
